item.title: European Airline Stocks Fall After Attack on Israel
item.description: European defence stocks rose sharply, while airline stocks fell on the news that Hamas launched an attack on Israel over the weekend.

item.title: Rio Tinto Backs Pilbara Outlook
item.description: Rio Tinto kept its guidance to cost and shipments for Pilbara unchanged for 2023 and targeted shipments of 323-338 million tons for next year.

item.title: Iran Helped Plot Attack on Israel Over Several Weeks
Eurozone Bond Markets Got 'Ice-Cold Shower' in September
item.description: The performance of eurozone government bonds was spoiled in September, as the third quarter ended with a plunge in bond prices, bringing the year-to-date performance to negative, LBBW said.

item.title: Metro Bank Agrees Funding Package with Investors
item.description: Metro Bank said it secured £925 million in funding to shore up its balance-sheet issues, in a move that will hit current investors and bondholders and make Colombian billionaire Jaime Gilinski Bacal the bank’s controlling shareholder.

item.title: Brent Oil Futures Could Surge Above $100/Bbl in Short Term
item.description: Oil prices rose sharply in Europe, with uncertainty over the situation in the Middle East mounting after the Hamas attack on Israel, and if Iran is linked to the attack, then its oil supply and exports face imminent downside risks, Commonwealth Bank of Australia said.

item.title: US Dollar's Dominant Role Seen Unlikely to Be at Large Risk
item.description: Morgan Stanley maintains a long position view on the dollar for now, as it said it “generally take[s] a more skeptical view of USD losing its ‘dominant currency’ crown, though some of the critiques are not unfounded.”

item.title: Schaeffler Makes €3.6 Billion Bid for Vitesco
item.description: Schaeffler has offered €91 a share in cash for Vitesco Technologies, the first of three steps toward a combination of the two companies.

item.title: China Evergrande New Energy Vehicle Investor Casts Doubt on Investment
item.description: Ongoing troubles at beleaguered property developer China Evergrande have cast a shadow over Nasdaq-listed NWTN’s investment in its electric-vehicle unit.

item.title: German Industrial Production Falls More Than Expected
item.description: Germany’s industrial output declined 0.2% in August, yet more negative news for the country’s key manufacturing base.

item.title: Investors worried about the recent pullback in stocks are counting on the coming earnings season to give them something to get excited about amid anxieties over the Fed's attitude to interest rates.
item.description: Investors worried about the recent pullback in stocks are counting on the coming earnings season to give them something to get excited about amid anxieties over the Fed’s attitude to interest rates.

item.title: Amid a strong labor market overall, employment opportunities for information technology professionals appear poor, according to an analysis by Janco Associates, which tracks federal data.
item.description: Amid a strong labor market overall, employment opportunities for information technology professionals appear poor, according to an analysis by Janco Associates, which tracks federal data.

item.title: Bristol Myers Squibb, the biopharmaceutical company, will acquire Mirati Therapeutics in a transaction that values the oncology developer at up to $5.8 billion.
item.description: Bristol Myers Squibb, the biopharmaceutical company, will acquire Mirati Therapeutics in a transaction that values the oncology developer at up to $5.8 billion.

item.title: The steep declines in prices of Treasurys are forcing markets to confront the possibility that the rates required to place the supply of bonds will be higher than anyone expected.
item.description: The steep declines in prices of Treasurys are forcing markets to confront the possibility that the rates required to place the supply of bonds will be higher than anyone expected.

item.title: High interest rates, driven by the Federal Reserve's higher-for-longer policy, are shaking up how corporate loans get done, throwing into relief the role played by private-credit funds.
item.description: High interest rates, driven by the Federal Reserve’s higher-for-longer policy, are shaking up how corporate loans get done, throwing into relief the role played by private-credit funds.

item.title: Intercontinental Exchange has plowed more than $23 billion into an ambitious, yearslong bet to overhaul the plumbing of the mortgage market, closing its biggest mortgage deal so far last month.
item.description: Intercontinental Exchange has plowed more than $23 billion into an ambitious, yearslong bet to overhaul the plumbing of the mortgage market, closing its biggest mortgage deal so far last month.

item.title: Nelson Peltz plans a fresh push for board seats at Disney following a relentless slide in the entertainment giant's shares.
item.description: Nelson Peltz plans a fresh push for board seats at Disney following a relentless slide in the entertainment giant’s shares.

item.title: GSK Partners With Zhifei on Vaccines in China
item.description: GSK said it has an exclusive agreement with Zhifei to co-promote its shingles vaccine Shingrix in China.

item.title: Hong Kong Shares to Resume Trading in Afternoon
item.description: Hong Kong trading will begin at 2 p.m. local time following the cancellation of a typhoon alert and a black rainstorm warning.

item.title: How Israel's Iron Dome Works
item.description: Israel’s Iron Dome missile-defense system is designed to intercept and destroy short-range rockets and mortars. It’s blocked thousands of missiles since 2011, including those launched by Hamas during this past weekend’s attack. Here’s how it works.
